column1: full ball outside off stump, shapes back in and goes away after pitching, Elgar with a short stride, lets it go
back of a length at off stump, squares him up as he defends off the back foot
back of a length outside off stump, no movement, left alone and it carries at waist height
back of a length at the hips, gets on his toes and pushes it to Wagner's right at fine leg
back of a length at off stump, hangs back and uses the angle to push it down to fine leg
137 kph, back of a length in the corridor, leaves it alone as it climbs
good length ball, shapes in at off stump, he pushes at it with hard hands to defend
good length, swinging in from outside off stump, let's it go
swings it into the pads at a length, Elgar puts in a small stride and works it behind square
back of a length, angling into the corridor, beats him on the outside edge as he defends inside the line
good length, wide outside off stump, nips in as he lets it go
good length ball outside off, he's not chasing those, lets it go
good length outside off stump, pokes at it with soft hands, and gets the inside half of the bat as he defends away from the body

a duck on debut for De Bruyn. Back of a length delivery outside off, once more he's feeling for it. This time it has straightened. He follows with his hands, away from his body, thick edge at a nice height to Latham at second slip
good length at the corridor, nervously blocks this close to the body, barely any feet
good length, wide outside off, lets it go
back of a length outside off, left alone
full ball dangled outside off, shapes away slightly and he lets it go

yet another Test batsman shoulders arms to a straight one. The around the wicket angle has worked against Elgar once more. Back of a length, starts outside off, angles in at off stump. This is a pitch where you can trust the bounce, but he's misjudged the length there and this one clips the top of off stump. He failed to cover the line.
back of a length outside off, Duminy skips across to cover his off stump as he lets it go
good length outside off stump, he's hopping as he feels for this away from the body and chops it into the pitch and to the slip cordon
good length outside off, solidly behind the line and defends firmly into the off side
back of a length outside off, this one nips away at chest height and he's happy to leave
good length, angled into the pads, tucked past square leg to get off the mark
good length outside off, slight movement away off the pitch as he lets it go
oooh. Makes him sway early on. Bouncer angles in at the crest on his helmet and he arches backwards to let it go
good length outside off, too wide to play, lets it go
back of a length, nips back in from the corridor and pings on the pads. That was climbing sharply into him
back of a length in the corridor, back and across for the defence
full outside off, pushes forward tentatively, not to the pitch as he pushes this in front of mid-off
floated full at off stump, winds up and drives it straight to mid-on
127 kph, good length, in the corridor, nips back but he's solidly behind it to defend
127 kph, full and angled in at the toes, waits on it and clips it behind square on the leg side
good length at off stump, shuffles slightly and defends back to the bowler
good length at off stump, shuffles across again and defends back to the bowler
wide of the crease, full at off stump, gets behind and drives it back to the bowler on the bounce. Got the toe of the bat
back of a length at leg stump, tickles it fine off the thigh guard
shot. Full ball outside off, he doesn't move his feet too much but this is in his hitting zone and he stands tall as he punches it past wide mid-off
good length ball, angled in at leg stump, tucks it off the back foot to fine leg's left
and repeat. This one is full and under his eyes as well, he doesn't have to reach out as much this time. High elbow, middle of the bat, extra cover boundary
good bowling. Pulls it slightly shorter than the boundary ball, gets some away movement. Teases him to attempt that shot again, but he lets it go
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length outside off, angles back in, opens the face as he drives on the up to point
good length outside off, defended into the off side with an open face
angled across the corridor at a length, pushes at it on the up, slices it to point with little control
good length, outside off, left alone
back of a length in the corridor, straightens on him. He plays for the angle on the back foot, thick inside edge to fine leg
good length, just outside, nips away and he lets it go
good length at off stump, defended back towards the bowler off the back foot
good length, angled across off stump, lets it go
back of a length at off stump, gets on his toes, smothers the bounce and drops it into the off side with soft hands
glorious shot. Full and angled away from off stump, he gets in a big stride and holds his shape as he executes this cover drive
good length outside off, judges the length this time and lets it go
back of a length in the corridor, caught in two minds as he pushes back. Wants to leave, ends up prodding at it and gets the outer half as he defends
good length, starts outside off, moves further away after pitching, left alone
back of a length outside off, moves away off the pitch, lets it go
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
good length, angled in at middle stump, stays rooted to the crease as he defends back to the bowler with a full face
wide of the crease, good length, angled in at off stump, defended into the off side
good length, moves it away from outside off, left alone

oh that's close! Full and angled in at middle stump, Duminy is playing for the outswing, and has to bring an angled bat at it last minute. Rapped in front of middle, but there was still some angle on this. Not out says the umpire, Bruce Oxenford. New Zealand have not reviewed it...it would have been out.
good length outside off, shapes away, thicks outside edge as he pokes away from the body
raps him in front of middle stump again, this time he's further forward and it gets him high on the pad, not out
good length at off stump, shapes away slightly, defended into the off stump off the front foot
good length, angled in at middle stump, pushed into the leg side off the front foot
good length ball, wide outside off, lets it go
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot into the off side
full outside off, not feet as he tries to crash this through the covers. The bat turns and he gets it off the inside half to mid-on
full at leg stump, pushed to mid-on off the toe of the bat. He wanted to whip this wide of that man
this one climbs off a length, but it's wide outside off and he lets it go, no trouble caused
back of a length in the corridor, watches it closely as it nips back, lets it go
oh wow. Full and angled in at off stump, he gets this on-drive right out of the middle, full face, past Duminy for four
full outside off, swinging away slightly, he's not to the pitch but gets this cover drive on the up off the middle
good length, angled in at leg stump, defended to midwicket
bouncer at off stump, shapes for the hook, it's too quick and he has to retreat at the last moment. Does so successfully.
back of a length in the corridor, hops across to cover his off stump as he lets it go
angled in at the hips at a length, tucked into the leg side off the back foot
swings this full ball into the pads at a good length, Amla clips it off knee height to fine leg's left
full at middle stump, driven back firmly but he gets down quickly and holds on to it
back of a length at middle stump, hops across off stump once more, covers the line and shovels this fine off his mid-riff
nearly balloons it back. Good length at leg stump, he's pushing well in front of the pads as this one climbs and angles across. Gets it high on the bat but safely in front of the bowler
yorker at middle stump, nearly locks himself with the movement across, but digs it out
good length at leg stump, tucked behind square off
full outside off, defended solidly into the off side
good length ball, fired down the leg side, no way of getting bat on that
good length outside off, slight angle out, lets it go
back of a length at off stump, gets deep in the crease and defends into the off side
full at middle stump, goes deep in the crease again. Thick inside edge down to fine leg. Should have been forward
back of a length at middle stump, back foot defence
back of a length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length at off stump, tapped into the off side off the back foot. Outside half of the bat
good length outside off, pushes in front of the pads again, uppishly towards wide mid-off
full at off stump, half-stride as he defends this late to gully off the outside half
full at off stump, defends it under his eyes, but it's the outside half of the bat again. Once more, the feet come after the shot
full at leg stump, driven straight to mid-off
good length in the corridor, goes back to this and defends it into the off side
back of a length outside off, left alone
short and wide outside off, climbs into this back foot drive, but finds cover point
good length ball angled in at off stump, defended into the off side off the back foot
good length at the pads, flicked to fine leg with the swing
good length outside off, covers the off stump and lets it go
good length outside off , not to the pitch as he drives on the up, inside half of the bat and it rolls back down the pitch
good length ball outside off, flies straight through after he lets it go
full outside off, drives on the up, the ball sits in the pitch and he gets this aerially to Broom's right at cover and he has dropped it low to his right and close to the ground
full ball outside off, driven into the off side off the toe of the bat

good length ball, raps him in front of leg stump. There's a loud appeal and it's deemed not out. New Zealand have reviewed this. It looked to have pitched outside leg...yes, tracking shows it pitched outside leg stump. The decision stands.
good length at off stump, defended into the off side off the front foot
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back into the off side
good length, angling in at off stump, defends it very late under his eyes
back of a length outside off, wants to run this through the slip cordon, but bunts it into the floor and to gully on the bounce
good length at off stump, defended to mid-on off the back foot
Amla trudges on. Full and floated at off stump, this swings in slightly as well but it's right in the zone for Amla. He leans in slightly and bisects his partner and the stumps at the other end
good length at off stump, holds it's line and jumps up slightly. He takes his bottom hand off as he defends off the outside half
good length outside off, plays for the swing but there isn't any. Beaten on the outside edge as he pushes forward
good length at middle stump, hangs deep in the crease and taps it into the leg side
good length at leg stump, gets on his toes and nudges it to fine leg
good length at off stump, solidly behind it as he defends back to the bowler
full outside off, lets it go
ooh. Full outside off, gets a stride in to defend, but this one has come in with the angle and gets the inside edge. He's safe though, as it rolls through square leg
back of a length at middle stump, shuffles into the off side and defends into the leg
back of a length outside off, left alone at waist height
shot. Back of a length outside off, uses his trigger movement to quickly transfer the weight onto his toes, stands tall and punches this through the covers
good length, angled in at off stump, shuffles across and whips it to midwicket
bouncer at off stump, ducks under it comfortably, pitch is too slow to worry him from that length
short of a length outside off, gets off his feet to defend this close to his body
attempted bouncer outside off, he ducks under it comfortably
good length, angled in at middle stump, defended to short midwicket
back of a length in the corridor, gets leg side of the ball and drops it into the floor off the back foot
full ball fired in at leg stump, gets his pad across the stumps and just about digs it out to mid-on
back of a length outside off, opens the face and pushes it straight to gully
overpitched outside off, late on this shot as he attempts to drive through the off side, digs it out to mid-off

goes wide of the crease and opens up a hug gap between bat and pad. Full outside off, he goes for the drive. Bat turns and he's lucky to get this much bat on it, albeit off the inside half. It trickles to short midwicket
tossed up full at middle stump, walks across, exposes two of his stumps but whips this past a deepish midwicket
tossed up outside off, walks across and whips this one too, straight to short midwicket
good length at off stump, defended into the leg side
back of a length outside off stump, hangs back and drives it to short midwicket
good length outside off, defended off the back foot
fired flat and full at middle stump, it is exposed again, but wrist and bat will keep that ball out with a forward defence
short ball at middle stump, gets on top of the bounce and tucks it along the ground to fine leg
bouncer at off stump, ducks under it, too short
back of a length at the thigh guard, glanced to fine leg
good length at off stump, defended off the sticker into the off side

got him! He's kept going after the short one, and this time he's cramped around his chest. It wasn't particularly fast, but he wasn't in a great position. Still swiveling as he played that short ball from middle stump, and he's taking his eyes off as he plays the shot. Top edge, straight to Patel at fine leg. It was a difficult stay for Duminy, but it's not the bowling that got him out there.
full outside off, left alone as it hobbles around in the air
back of a length outside off, lets it go

Faf is nearly run out! Full ball outside off, pushes at it in front of his body, gets a thick outside edge that goes straight to Williamson at gully. They have no business running for that, Williamson picks up, has a shy and misses. Faf was at least four yards out
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
full at off stump, drives it sweetly to Santner at mid-off, who is late getting down on it as it bounces in front of him. Fumbles and gives away a run
good length at off stump, goes back in the crease and defends off the inside half
good length outside off, left alone
good length outside off, shuffles across and pushes it back to the bowler off the front foot
good length, angled in at middle stump, squares him up as he tries to whip this with the angle and is forced to push it back to the bowler
ooooh uppish. Good length at off stump, climbing on him as he drives on the up. Falls a couple of yards in front of mid-off before skidding into his outstretched hands
good length at middle stump, defended into the leg side
good length at off stump, goes back and dinks it onto his boot off the under edge as he pushes slightly away from the body
short ball outside off, watches it closely as he gets on top of it and rolls the wrist to keep it down to deep square leg
full at middle stump, defended back to the bowler with a dead bat
back of a length at off stump, plenty of time to hang back and punch off the back foot to mid-on
back of a length at off stump, back foot defence
good length at off stump, that movement away again, but he has the line cover even though he gets a thick outside edge that falls short of second slip
back of a length outside off, too short at this pace on this pitch. Hangs back nice and tall and punches it, front foot in the air, through extra cover
good length ball at off stump, slight shape away, forward defence into the leg side
good length outside off, shape away, lets it go
back of a length at off stump, walks across the stumps and rides the bounce as he glances this behind square on the leg side
good length at off stump, camps on the back foot and defends back to the bowler
full at off stump, gets low and paddles it fine, safe shot
good length at leg stump, pushed into the leg side off the pads
good length at middle stump, back foot defence
good length outside off, forward defence
back of a length outside off, pushed to mid-off off the back foot
good length at leg stump, jumps on him as he leans in to defend, takes his bottom hand off
full outside off, driven firmly, straight to mid-off
full outside off, more room on this one and he expands his arms as he leans in, turns his wrists at the very last moment and gets it past cover point. It was slightly uppish, but we past the fielder

good length at middle stump, it straightens slightly and catches him in front of middle, bat and back leg jammed close together. Another review against the lbw decision. It was given not out....and it will remain not out because that came off the middle of the bat.
back of a length at off stump, big gap between bat and pad as he pokes away from the body and gets the inside half of the bat
full at middle stump, angling down leg, tickled fine with the angle
good length outside off, jumps off a length along with the away movement, left alone
good length outside off, not as much movement this time, left alone again
full at off stump, defended into the off side
full outside off, he covers the off stump and lets it go
good length at off stump, behind the line and defended back to the bowler
full at off stump, slight shape in as he looks to drive this down the ground. Toe of the bat
good length ball, well outside off, leaves it alone
back of a length, angling in at off stump, jumps up and turns this off his hips to fine leg
good length outside off, lets it go
back of a length at off stump, spits at him from the pitch and gets him high on the bat as he pushes away from the body

loud appeal for caught behind, and Wagner has to look down in dismay as there's no review remaining. This one was at a good length outside off, slight feather says snicko as he appears to be beaten on the outside edge. That would have been overturned.
good length, angled in at leg stump, flicked behind square off the pads
good length outside off, cuts away sharply as he lets it go
good length at off stump, keeps low as he shuffles across and taps this into the leg side
good length outside off, goes deep and defends off the back foot
full and angled into the pads, doesn't have to move too much for this, whips it through square leg and brings up his 32nd Test fifty
back of a length outside off, left alone as it moves away
good length, in the corridor, swings back in late and just brushes past the pad. Good leave, in the end
good length outside off, this one doesn't swings back in as much, lets it go
good length at off stump, nips back in, inside edge and thuds into the pad
good length outside off, lets it go with the angle
good length, angled across from the corridor, takes his bat away the last moment to let it go
the line remains the same, but he's dropped it slightly short. Faf climbs into the release ball and punches it past cover
123 kph, full ball swinging away late, but not troubling Amla who defends off the middle of the bat
full at middle stump, pushed to mid-on with feet rooted to the crease
good length at middle stump, defended into the leg side
good length, teasing outside off, swings away last moment and he lets it go
gone! Out, in, in, out and in again to get him out. Full at middle stump, goes across the line to whip this through midwicket, it slides through from under his bat and thuds into the stumps
back of a length at off stump, gets behind it and defends off the back foot
good length at off stump, climbs on him and gets the outside half on his back foot defence
good length outside off, plugging away at that line, Faf leaves this one
thick outside edge. Good length, in the corridor, angles away slightly and he opens the face to run it through the slip cordon
back of a length outside off, high back lift, but lets it go
top edge and over the keeper. Surprises him with the bouncer. This is at his front shoulder and hurries him as he's camping on the back foot and goes for the hook
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler
good length at off stump, moves away slightly as he walks into the defence and gets the outside half
good length outside off, firmly behind this as he defends off the front foot
good length, swinging away wide outside off, lets it go
good length, angled in at off stump, hurries on him and it gets his boot via the blade of the bat that came down late
good length ball, swinging, too wide again, left alone

wide of the crease, full ball at middle stump, not too different from the Amla delivery. But Bavuma offers the full face and punches it past mid-on, who gives a chase and slides to pull it back at the boundary. Santner, that was.
full at leg stump, holds his balance and pushes this wide of mid-on. This time it's the other spinner, Jeetan Patel who gives chase and pulls it back in with a slide at the midwicket boundary
good length, in the corridor, straightens after shaping in, left alone
good length, tailing in at the pads, whipped to fine leg off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
full and tailing in towards off stump, short stride as he pushes this off the inside half to mid-off
back of a length outside off, wants to pull but it's too wide. Closes the face and taps it into the leg side. Dangerous shot on a slow pitch
good length outside off, this one keeps low after pitching and the outside edge falls short of second slip
good length at off stump, defended from the crease
good length outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, defended solidly off the front foot
good length at off stump, hangs back and defends off the back foot under his eyes
full outside off, leans into the cover drive but hasn't timed or connected that. Has found the gap nevertheless and that's two
back of a length outside off, thumps this back foot drive, but straight to mid-off
full and angled in at middle stump, driven to mid-on off the inside half
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot, back to the bowler
full outside off stump, short stride as he drives away from the body, straight to mid-off
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length outside off, waits for it and controls the outside edge, gets it past gully

oh great bowling. Full at off stump, slight shape away - what is called the faster mens' magic ball. Bavuma wants to drive this through the leg side but gets a thick outside edge that flies past gully's right for a four
back of a length outside off, shoulders arms
back of a length outside off, no feet, defended into the off side, away from the body
good length ball outside, he's in two minds. Wants to leave this, ends up hanging the bat away from his body, bunts it into the ground and to gully
back of a length outside off, pushed to extra cover off the back foot
back of a length outside off, drives off the back foot, away from the body. Broom trots across from point and dives to stop it
good length at leg stump, pushed into the leg side off the front foot
full outside off, short stride as middles this drive on the up. Henry dives to his left at mid-off and saves a certain boundary

Wagner is a patient man. Full and wide outside off, wants to throw his hands at this and bludgeon it through the off side. Nowhere close to the pitch, bat turns in his hands and it squeezes out to mid-off
yorker, swinging in at off stump, foot goes across, then away as he jams this one to mid-off
back of a length outside off, hangs back and pushes with hard hands into the off side
throws one up full outside off, this time he lets it go, stumps not covered but it was wide enough
outside off, very wide, left alone and carried through to Watling
shorter and wider, driven off the back foot past a diving point fielder
at a length, honing in on middle and off, du Plessis pushes into the on-side
back of a length, outside off, not making him play at all. Du Plessis watches it through to Watling
good length, angled in, pushed to mid-wicket
du Plessis on the back foot, bunts this length into the covers
on the back foot, drives this good length ball to mid-on
good length line outside off, left alone
full and driven into the covers, lots of fielders there and Bavuma can't get through
short and picked up, Bavuma sees that early and hammers it over square leg, lots of power behind that
pitched up fuller, left on length
full and swinging away, driven into the covers off the toe of the bat
full outside off, short stride in and driven to mid-off
good length outside off, straightens slightly after pitching, left alone
back of a length outside off, lets it go, straight through and dipping on Watling
back of a length outside off, deviates away, too wide so Du Plessis won't play at it
back of a length at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler off the back foot
good length outside off, this one slides through low, Du Plessis is rooted to the crease and throws his arms at this, thick inside edge flies past the stumps and to the fine leg boundary
full and swinging in at off stump, driven on the up to mid-off
back of a length at off stump, gets on his toes and pushes it to cover off the back foot
short and angling away from him outside off, hangs low in the crease and places the cut past Broom at point
back of a length outside off, stands tall and punches straight to point with an open face
full and fired in at leg stump, pushed back to the bowler, checked his shot there. Was looking to flick this initially
back of a length outside off, angles in, but well away from the stumps. Lets it go
back of a length in the corridor, stays put and waits for it to cut back in before offering the full face to defend into the off side
139 kph, back of a length outside off, stays deep after his shuffle across and slaps this pull shot in front of square on the leg side

137 kph, back of a length outside off, slices it off the back foot and screams 'yes yes yes', then 'no no no' as gully dives to cut it off and has a shy. Bavuma is halfway down, wants to run the overthrow but deep square leg has come in quickly and in the end it's a dramatic passage for no run
good length at off stump, back foot defence into the off side
good length outside off, marginal movement away before it pitches, skids straight through after and he lets it go
137 kph, good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler off the back foot. Big gap between bat and pad there
132 kph, floated full outside off stump, he leans into the drive but gets it straight to Santner at cover
short and wide outside off, stays put again, waits for it to come to him and chops it late between gully and point
136 kph, full and angling away from off stump, driven to cover off the toe of the bat
136 kph, good length and well wide outside off, left alone
good length outside off, covers the line and lets it go as it climbs past him
good length at off stump, defended off the front foot into the off side
134 kph, back of a length outside off, mistimed back foot punch to point
good length outside off, angling in from wide outside off, lets it go without covering his stumps
132 kph, back of a length outside off, drives on the up, through the line, wide of mid-off

and a freak dismissal against the run of play. This is 137 kph, back of a length outside off and slightly deviating away as Bavuma stands tall to play the pull shot. It was short enough for the shot, but the slowness of the pitch has done him. He's through the pull early and it catches the closed face of the toe of the bat and flies through to first slip, where Raval takes it comfortably in front of his chest
full and tailing in at middle stump, flicks it off the inside half of the bat to midwicket
oh this one has taken off from a length. Good length at off stump, nips back and jumps on him as he fends in front of the body
good length, swinging in at leg stump, watches closely and closes the face at the last moment to push it to deep square leg
135 kph, bouncer at middle stump, hurriedly ducks under it
ohh shaky. Full and swinging away from off stump, tries to drive through the line, gets it off the inside half to mid-on
full outside off, tries to drive through the line again, once again the bat turns and it rolls feebly along to mid-on
back of a length at off stump, climbs on him and he arches backwards to let it go
full at off stump, this time he closes the face slightly as he drives, still the inside half, not timed, but past mid-on's riight
back of a length at middle stump, stays deep in the crease and tucks it to fine leg off the hips
good length at off stump, slight tail in, short stride and he pushes it into the leg side on the up

nearly chops it on! Good length at off stump, there's a slight angle away and this catches the outside half off the bat as he defends away from the body. Bunts it into the ground, it bounces towards the stumps but he kicks it away just in time
shot. Full and floated at off stump, this time he's close to the ball and he punches it past Faf
good length, angled across off stump, smothers the angle and whips across the line to deep square leg
good length at off stump, climbs sharply as he defends, shoulder of the bat and a couple of bounces to second slip
ooh sneaks through the defence. Good length outside off, he's pushing away from the body again, feet rooted and this nips back between bat and pad and goes through to Watling
back of a length outside off, goes for the expansive drive on the up, chops it into the pitch off the under edge
bouncer at leg stump, curries him as he jumps to defend, but tails down the leg side after pitching
a loud appeal for caught behind down the leg side. This is another bouncer that's angled in at him, catches the right tricep on the way through as he tries to let it go. Umpire rules correctly
bouncer at middle stump, this time he's deep in the crease and hits the pull shot along the ground to fine leg
back of a length at leg stump, watches it closely and tucks it past square and to fine leg's left with soft hands
full at off stump, puts in a small stride and offers the full face to defend to mid-on
136 kph, full outside off, jams it to mid-off's right
back of a length at middle stump, shuffles back and across and dabs it to deep square leg
back of a length at middle stump, gets on his toes and tucks it off his hips to fine leg
good length in the corridor, angles in and straightens, good leave after shaping to hit this
good length, angled in at off stump, pokes at this in front of his body, inside edge onto boot and into the off side
good length outside off, defended into the off side
drops it short at off stump, goes deep in the crease and chops it late past backward point
back of a length at off stump, waits on it and opens the face to push it past slip, takes off for a run but backward point gets across quickly
arm ball at  length, leg stump, defended to short leg
good length, tossed up at a middle stump line, defended into the off side
full at leg stump, gives him the charge and pushes it to mid-on
120 kph, good length ball, swinging away from off stump, defended late into the off side
back of a length outside off, moving away, left alone
121 kph, full at off stump, swinging away, a good stride in as he drives this sweetly to mid-off
good bowling. Brings this one back in from a length, Faf plays it very late under his eyes and just keeps it out with a back foot defence
full outside off, nervous defence at this, ball thuds into the bat and nearly bounces onto the off stump
good length at leg stump, goes on the back foot and glances this to fine leg
good length at off stump, defended off the inside half into the leg side
good length at middle stump, pushes off the back foot into the leg side
good length outside off, back foot defence, outside half
good length at off stump, gives it the charge, gets to the pitch and pushes it to steal a single at mid-on
good length at off stump, bunted into the off side off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, plays this off the stumps really late, cuts straight to backward point

short ball, gets up considerably and de Grandhomme ducks underneath

driven into covers

off the outside edge and to the third man boundary. Duminy making the batsman drive and again no feet from Henry

Elgar sticks his bat out without covering the line and the ball straightens late outside off to find the outside edge

oh, what a disaster! That was really the worst way of getting out. Amla taps this fuller ball just to the right of mid-off. The fielder has to move to his right and run in and they sense a single. Amla calls for it and de Bruyn is initially reluctant. De Bruyn had turned around and wasn't aware that Amla wanted the run. Turns back and sees the call and responds to it. And they collide straight into each other. Amla fall, too, but he is more or less there and is able to recover and make his ground. But de Bruyn had barely covered one-fourth of the distance. No way he was going to be able to make it to the keeper's end

He goes for it anyway. Nothing on HotSpot and Snicko does not show anything. It was good length, opened him up and shaped away late. Probably that late deviation prompted the review

New Zealand have lost both their reviews now...
